com.mumfrey.liteloader

Interface PlayerInteractionListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Exposable, Listener, LiteMod

    public interface PlayerInteractionListener
extends LiteMod
    Interface for mods which want to observe the player's "interaction" status (player mouse clicks), allows block interaction events to be cancelled.
    Author:
    Adam Mummery-Smith

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  PlayerInteractionListener.MouseButton
      Mouse buttons

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onPlayerClickedAir(EntityPlayerMP player, PlayerInteractionListener.MouseButton button, BlockPos tracePos, EnumFacing traceSideHit, MovingObjectType traceHitType)
      Called when the player clicks but does not "hit" a block, the trace position is raytraced to the player's current view distance and represents the block which the player is "looking at".
      boolean onPlayerClickedBlock(EntityPlayerMP player, PlayerInteractionListener.MouseButton button, BlockPos hitPos, EnumFacing sideHit)
      Calls when the player clicks and hits a block, usually indicates that the player is digging or placing a block, although a block placement does not necessarily succeed.

        getVersion, init, upgradeSettings

    • Method Detail

      • onPlayerClickedAir

        void onPlayerClickedAir(EntityPlayerMP player,
                        PlayerInteractionListener.MouseButton button,
                        BlockPos tracePos,
                        EnumFacing traceSideHit,
                        MovingObjectType traceHitType)
        Called when the player clicks but does not "hit" a block, the trace position is raytraced to the player's current view distance and represents the block which the player is "looking at". This method is not called when the player right clicks with an empty hand.
        Parameters:
        player - Player
        button - Mouse button the user clicked
        tracePos - Raytraced location of the block which was hit
        traceSideHit - Raytraced side hit
        traceHitType - Type of hit, will be MISS if the trace expired without hitting anything (eg. the player clicked the sky)

      • onPlayerClickedBlock

        boolean onPlayerClickedBlock(EntityPlayerMP player,
                             PlayerInteractionListener.MouseButton button,
                             BlockPos hitPos,
                             EnumFacing sideHit)
        Calls when the player clicks and hits a block, usually indicates that the player is digging or placing a block, although a block placement does not necessarily succeed. Return true from this callback to allow the action to proceed, or false to cancel the action. Cancelling the action does not prevent further handlers from receiving the event.
        Parameters:
        player - Player
        button - Mouse button that was pressed, left = dig, right = interact
        hitPos - Block which was *hit*. Note that block placement will normally be at hitPos.offset(sideHit)
        sideHit - Side of the block which was hit
        Returns:
        true to allow the action to be processed (another listener may still inhibit the action), return false to cancel the action (other listeners will still be notified)
